So I saw the new Potter movie, and it was only aight (that's about 3 1/2 stars). While the animation was good, it was way too different than the book. Here's a partial list of where the movie went off on a tangent: - Instead of listening in on Weasley's dad and the minister of magic, Mr. Weasley tells Harry directly about Sirius - Harry doesn't get a note from Hagrid about the Monster Book of Monsters - Not enough teasing of Harry by Malfoy - NOTHING about blugworms (I think that's what they were called), the worms Hagrid has them study for the rest of the year - None of their exams - No house cup - The firebolt comes at the end, and isn't confiscated - No quiddich cup - Ron and Hermione don't listen to the minister, McGonagall, and the tavern witch talk about Sirius - Hermione successfully imitates the mating call of a werewolf (!?) - Harry doesn't think it odd that Lupin can read the map when it's supposedly a secret - Not much mention of Hermione's huge course load - No "Snape is poisoning Lupin!" theory I mean, I've heard of Creative liberties, but come on! Yeah, I realize that none of this matters in the greater scheme of things, but it's nice to watch a movie adapted from a book and actually know what's gonna happen next. And that's my rant for today.
